content:
Digest DNA
Minigel:
RNA

LA5
SgLy ll'  
Procedures
5ug DNA
H20 to 100 ul
10 ul of appropriate 10X buffer (usually provided by
supplier alternatively check back of any molecular
biology catalog).
10 units restriction enzyme.
Digest 1~2 hours 37 deg. C.
Check digestion by running about 500ng on-0.7%
agarose minigel adjacent to undigested plasmid.
Examine DNA by UV flouresence of DNA/Ethidium Br
complex (note: ethidium bromideflouresces in uv
light when complexed with nucleic acids).
Extract DNA by adding equal volume of
phenol/chloroform and shaking vigorously for about 2
min. Spin on microfuge 5 min.
Remove upper aqueous layer, avoiding interphase and
add to new tube. Either precipitate DNA, or extract
once more with chloroform alone. Again aqueous
layer is on top. Precipitate DNA by bringing
aqueous layer to 0.3 Na0Ac ph 5.2, then adding 2
volumes of the final volume of ethanol. Mix and
freeze at -20 deg. C.
For 25 ml minigel add 0.175 of agarose to small
flask. .Add 20 H20. Heat tx: boiling
swirling flask occasionally. When completely
dissolved 2.5 ul of 5mg/ml Ethidium Br. Place flask
in refrigerator.
Tape off ends of minigel with labelling tape. Place
apparatus in refrigerator. When agarose has cooled
pour into form, add comb, and let harden.
Fill tanks and cover gel with 1X TBE. Add H20 to
DNA sample to bring to 10 ul. Add 2 ul laoding
buffer, and mix. .Add sample to wells in gel and run
at 60 until the bromophenol blue has run about 1/2
the length of the gel. Remove gel and examine with
UV light.
Spin DNA 10 min. in Microfuge. Pour off ethanol.
Rinse tube with fresh 70% ethanol to remove any
salt contaminants. Pour off and dry tube in
Speed Vac.
